definition: to wish/to express good wishes/to pray/(old) wizard

sentences.english: Fireworks welcomed the new year in moscow's red square.
sentences.chinese: 人們在莫斯科紅場燃放煙花慶祝新年。

sentences.english: But that isn't something worth celebrating, at least not for Chinese mayors.
sentences.chinese: 可惜這並不值得慶祝，至少對於中國的市長們是如此。

sentences.english: And let me know when you finish, I'll come over with Bianca to enjoy it together.
sentences.chinese: 當你完成時請告訴我，我會和比安卡一起爲你慶祝。

sentences.english: Shou was bestowed by Empress Dowager Cixi when she presented the Empress with the embroidered tapestry, Eight Immortals Celebrating Birthday.
sentences.chinese: 壽被賦予慈溪太后她皇后繡掛毯，八老慶祝生日。

sentences.english: In Malaysia, officials have warned Muslims against celebrating.
sentences.chinese: 在馬拉西亞，官方已經警告過穆斯林要反對慶祝了。

sentences.english: We usually have the celebration with feasts and firecrackers.
sentences.chinese: 我們通常以豐盛的閤家宴和鞭炮來慶祝新年。

sentences.english: They celebrate his birthday with a dance party.
sentences.chinese: 他們舉辦一個舞會來慶祝他的生日。

sentences.english: Today, the faculty of Fuyong Middle School will hold the 40th anniversary celebration.
sentences.chinese: 今天，福永中學將隆重舉行建校40週年慶祝活動。

sentences.english: Many foreigners now go to Hanshan Temple to celebrate Chinese New Year.
sentences.chinese: 現在有許多外國人也去寒山寺慶祝春節。

sentences.english: Why don't we （crack）open a bottle of champagne to celebrate?
sentences.chinese: 我們何不開瓶香檳酒慶祝一下呢？

sentences.english: It is proposed that the occasion should be marked by a dinner.
sentences.chinese: 有人提議應該設宴慶祝這個重大活動。

sentences.english: It is not hard to see the reasons for celebrating the end of the line for has-been leaders.
sentences.chinese: 對昔日領導人的末日進行慶祝的原因並不難理解。

sentences.english: He says he has no plans to celebrate on the big day.
sentences.chinese: 他說，他不打算在大婚日進行任何形式的慶祝。

sentences.english: The dog's way of celebrating was to eat part of the pregnancy test kit.
sentences.chinese: 馬利喫掉了一部分驗孕棒來表達它對此事的慶祝。

sentences.english: Christians celebrate the resurrection of Christ from the death.
sentences.chinese: 基督教徒們慶祝耶穌基督的復活。

definition: to exercise/to move about/to operate/to use connections (personal influence)/loose/shaky/active/movable/activity/campaign/maneuver/behavior/CL:項|项[xiang4],個|个[ge4]
on the eve of/to be about to/to be on the verge of
